column2: A moving visit to the Shanghai Jewish Refugees Museum to learn about the safe haven for Jewish refugees in this city during World War II. Many later found a home in the US, including Secretary of the Treasury, Michael Blumenthal. A sobering reminder of the horrors of Nazism.

column2: January 28, 2023, marks the 20th anniversary of President George W. Bush’s State of the Union address first announcing the United States President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR), the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

column2: BREAKING NEWS: This is an announcement that has been decades in the making. On December 5, 2022 a team from DOE's  Lab made history by achieving fusion ignition. This breakthrough will change the future of clean power and America’s national defense forever.
column3: 突发新闻：这一消息的背后是数十年的耕耘。 2022年12月5日，一支来自美国能源部劳伦斯・利弗莫尔国家实验室 Lab的研究团队实现了聚变点火，从而创造了历史。 这一突破将从此改变清洁能源以及美国国防的未来。

column2: There is one side, there is one party that seeks to change the status quo, the cross-strait status quo that has been at the center of stability and security across the Taiwan Strait for some 40 years now. It is not the United States. It is not Taiwan.

column2: Over my decades in foreign policy, I’ve never seen a time when the demands on our diplomacy were so great, or when our ability to meet them had a bigger impact on the lives of Americans. Our proposed budget helps ensure can meet those demands.
column3: 在我从事外交政策的几十年中，我从未看到过有哪个时候如此需要我们的外交，或者有哪个时候我们满足这些需求的能力如此影响到美国人的生活。我们提出的预算方案有助于确保美国国务院 能够满足这些需求。

column2: Some of the most powerful impacts of our actions will come over time as we squeeze Russia’s access to finance and technology for strategic sectors of its economy. Along with our Allies and partners, we estimate we will cut off more than half of Russia’s high-tech imports.
column3: 随着我们收紧俄罗斯为其经济的战略部门获取融资和技术的渠道，并在今后数年降低其工业产能，我们的行动将造成的一些最有威力的影响会在长期显现。 我们的行动以及盟国和伙伴所采取的行动估计将切断俄罗斯二分之一以上的高端技术进口。

column2: Congrats to Tianjin 's 34 inaugural graduates! I was proud to speak virtually at your commencement ceremony with . I believe music is a bridge for the Chinese and American people.

column2: A more diverse, equitable, inclusive, and accessible Department leads to a stronger, smarter, and more effective workforce to handle the foreign policy challenges of the 21st Century. Follow our new office to learn more about the Department’s DEIA efforts.
column3: 一个更加多元、公平、共融和可及（DEIA）的美国国务院带来更加强有力、更加智慧并且更加有效的员工队伍，来应对21世纪的外交政策挑战。关注我们新设的国务院多元与共融办公室的账号，详细了解国务院的 DEIA 工作。

column2: Today, based on their temperament and commitment to be productive members of society, I hereby pardon this year’s National Thanksgiving Turkey – Chocolate. And should he be unable to uphold his duties I also hereby pardon his alternate, Chip.

column2: We are heartbroken by and strongly condemn the killing of American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh in the West Bank. The investigation must be immediate and thorough and those responsible must be held accountable. Her death is an affront to media freedom everywhere.
column3: 我们心碎地知悉并强烈谴责美国记者希琳·阿布·阿克勒（Shireen Abu Akleh）在约旦河西岸遇害一事。必须立即进行彻底的调查，肇事者必须被绳之以法。她的遇难是对各地媒体自由的侮辱。

column2: EarthDay is personal for each of us. Libby and I have 3 daughters & 2 grandchildren. Their future, everyone’s future, means we must protect our planet. Grateful for ’s leadership & proud we show 🇺🇸 art about the environment to the 🇨🇳 people.

column2: As discussed in his interview with , what we’ve seen since the killing of Mahsa Amini has been the extraordinary courage of Iranian young people, especially women. The U.S. will continue to support Iranians exercising their universal rights.

column2: The people of Central America deserve the opportunity to create a more democratic, prosperous, and safe region. Today, with the release of the 2022 list of those who undermine democracy or engage in corruption, we support those building a brighter future.

column2: On the 13th anniversary of Sergei Magnitsky’s untimely death, we once again call on Russian authorities to hold all those responsible accountable. No one in Russia should be targeted for exposing corruption and exercising human rights and fundamental freedoms.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：在谢尔盖·马格尼茨基（Sergei Magnitsky）英年早逝的第13个周年纪念日，我们再次要求俄罗斯当局对肇事者追究责任。在俄罗斯，没有人应该因为揭露腐败以及行使人权与基本自由而成为被针对的目标。

column2: Our historic U.S. Consulate General Shanghai, built in 1921, is an architectural gem. This American flag flew over the consulate when the U.S. left China in 1950. We’ve been back since 1980 and are here to stay.
column3: 始建于1921年的美国驻上海总领事馆是历史悠久的建筑瑰宝。美国于1950年离华之时，这面美国国旗飘扬在领事馆上空。我们从1980年起回到这里，并且会继续留在这里。

column2: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. was the most important American leader of the post-WWII era. He challenged us to face the legacy of Slavery, Jim Crow, Segregation and an unequal country. He made us a better and stronger nation. Profoundly thankful for his life and work.
column3: 牧师小马丁·路德·金博士是二战后最重要的美国领袖。他激发我们去直面奴隶制的遗留问题、“吉姆·克劳法”、种族隔离，以及一个不平等的国家。他让我们成为一个更好、更强大的国家。深深感谢他和他毕生的贡献。

column2: Today in 1963, Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his "I Have a Dream" speech at the March on Washington. He spoke on civil and economic rights, calling for an end to racism. We continue to work toward racial equity and an America and world where all can reach their full potential.
column3: 1963年的今天（8月28日），马丁·路德·金在华盛顿大游行中发表了《我有一个梦想》（I Have a Dream）演说。他谈到了公民和经济权利，呼吁结束种族主义。我们继续努力实现种族平等，创造人人都能充分实现其潜能的美国和世界。

column2: We are glad that U.S. citizen Kyaw Htay Oo will soon be reunited with his family in the United States. We welcome the release of other foreign citizens and continue to call for the release of all those who remain unjustly imprisoned in Burma.
column3: 我们很高兴美国公民觉泰乌(Kyaw Htay Oo)将很快与他在美国的家人团聚。我们也欢迎其他外国公民的获释，并继续呼吁释放所有仍在缅甸被不公正监禁的人。

column2: One year after the July 11 demonstrations in Cuba, we recognize the determination and courage of the Cuban people in their long struggle for democracy. The United States stands with the Cuban people, and we urge the Cuban regime to respect their voices. 11J
column3: 在7月11日古巴示威活动一年后，我们赞赏古巴人民为争取民主而进行长期斗争的决心和勇气。美国与古巴人民站在一起，我们敦促古巴政权尊重古巴人民的声音。

column2: Today is Labor Day in the United States. A federal holiday since 1894, we honor & recognize the “laborers”—the men & women who have built America throughout our history. Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. said of them: “All labor that uplifts humanity has dignity and importance."
column3: 今天是美国劳工节。自1894年以来的联邦法定节假日，我们向“劳工们“，我们的历史中，一路建设美国的男男女女，致敬并予以赞扬。牧师马丁·路德·金博士对他们的感言，”一切人类的劳动都是有尊严有价值的”。

column2: At the Security Council today, we’re hearing more bizarre conspiracy theories from Russia, things that sound like they were forwarded to them on a chain email from some dark corner of the internet. has a word for this kind of talk: malarkey.

column2: Asked about the horrifying images coming out of Bucha, told this morning that we can’t become numb to this—we can’t normalize this. This is the reality of what’s going on every single day and why the Kremlin's war needs to end.

column2: Yesterday, it was my honor to announce new investments in African youth programming and entrepreneurship. Africa is home to the youngest population in the world, and the ideas, innovations, and initiatives of these young leaders will benefit all of us.

column2: The G20 Forum starts in Bali today. Local crises often become global challenges. That is why multilateral cooperation through fora like the G20 is more important than ever. Together we can counter challenges like food and energy insecurity worsened by Russia's war on Ukraine.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：20国集团 G20 论坛今天在巴厘岛启动。地方危机往往会发展为全球性挑战。这就是为什么通过像20国集团（G20）这样的论坛开展多边合作比以往任何时候都更加重要。齐心协力，我们可以共同应对粮食和能源安全危机等因俄罗斯对乌克兰发动的战争而变得更为严峻的挑战。

column2: The U.S. stands with 49 other Member States in urging China to uphold its international human rights obligations and implement the recommendations from the report on the situation of Uyghurs and other Turkic Muslim minorities in Xinjiang.

column2: We call on the Kremlin to immediately stop its pre-meditated and systematic operation, which has been reported to “filter” out Ukrainian citizens and forcibly disappear, detain, or deport them to seize Ukraine’s territory and subjugate its population.

column2: The United States will continue — consistent with our One China policy — to deepen our ties with Taiwan, including through continuing to advance our economic and trade relationship.

column2: Russia’s cyber activities targeting Ukraine may be less visible than its missile and artillery bombardments, but they are key pieces of the Kremlin’s unjustified war. Today we are sharing the truth about these activities.

column2: We also honor the memory of journalists and media workers killed worldwide in the past year—including at least 12 in Ukraine alone since Russia's war of aggression began. We honor their sacrifice and bravery to bring truth to light. WorldPressFreedomDay

column2: .: We said we’d restore American leadership in the climate crisis. Well, on day one, we rejoined the Paris Agreement. We raised global ambitions to reduce emissions through major investments in climate finance — including quadrupling our own funding.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：我们说过，我们将恢复美国在气候危机中的领导地位。那么，在第一天，我们就重新加入了《巴黎协定》。我们通过对气候融资的重大投资提高了全球减排的雄心--包括将我们自己投入的资金翻了两番。

column2: will soon release its first ever Development Response to the PRC Policy. China’s admirable economic transformation over recent decades is due in no small part to a strong intl. order. The PRC should allow other countries the same opportunities they've benefited from.

column2: There’s so much to celebrate about the massive strides we made on clean energy in 2022 — and still more to do! Take a look back at a year of big milestones with our Clean Energy Retrospective and get ready for a bright, clean 2023 ️

column2: We condemn the Russian Federation’s missile attack on the International Center for Peacekeeping and Security in Yavoriv, close to Ukraine’s border with Poland. The brutality must stop.

column2: Congratulations to this year’s winners, including 🇺🇸 economists , Douglas Diamond, & Philip Dybvig, chemists & K. Barry Sharpless, & physicist John Clauser! The 🇺🇸 now is home to 403 Nobel laureates. Proud.
column3: 恭喜今年的诺贝尔奖得奖人，包括美国经济学家本·伯南克、道格拉斯·戴蒙德和菲利普·迪布维格，化学家卡罗琳·贝托齐和巴里·夏普莱斯，以及物理学家约翰·克劳泽！美国 诺贝尔奖桂冠得主现在达到403名。倍感骄傲。

column2: Today I unveiled a mural honoring Congressman Robert N.C. Nix Sr., the first African American elected to the House of Representatives from Pennsylvania. This art honors his legacy and sits on the walls of the Robert N.C. Nix, Sr. Federal Building, home to our new passport agency.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：今天，我为一座纪念国会议员罗伯特·N·C·尼克斯（Robert N.C. Nix Sr.）的壁画揭幕，他是宾夕法尼亚州当选的第一位众议院非裔美国人议员。这件艺术品纪念了他的遗产，并坐落于我们新的护照机构所在地罗伯特·N·C·尼克斯联邦大楼（Robert N.C. Nix, Sr. Federal Building）的墙面上。

column2: I had the pleasure to join the first leaders meeting of the United States, India, Israel, and the United Arab Emirates. Together, the I2U2 will harness the vibrancy and entrepreneurial spirit of our nations to tackle some of the greatest challenges confronting our world.
column3: 拜登总统：我很高兴参加美国、印度、以色列和阿拉伯联合酋长国（I2U2）的首次领导人会议。 齐心协力，I2U2线上活动将利用我们各国的活力和企业家精神来应对我们世界面临的一些最大挑战。

column2: To the people of Russia: You deserve to live in peace and with dignity, just like Ukrainians. Just like people everywhere.
column3: 致俄罗斯人民：你们理应有尊严地生活在和平中，正如乌克兰人，正如各地的人们。

column2: . on the International Day of the Girl Child: Empowering girls is a priority for the United States, and that means we must prioritize their education, their future leadership and the prevention and response to the disproportionate gender-based violence they face.
column3: 美国国务院发言人 谈国际女童日：为女孩赋权是美国的一项优先事项。这意味着我们必须优先考虑她们的教育，她们的未来领导力，以及预防和应对她们所面临的不成比例的基于性别的暴力。

column2: On today’s International Day Commemorating Victims of Acts of Violence Based on Religion or Belief, we stand with those who have been targeted or persecuted for their beliefs. To those who are still suffering: you are not forgotten, and we continue to fight for you.
column3: 今天是基于宗教或信仰的暴力行为受害者国际纪念日，我们与那些因信仰而成为目标或遭受迫害的人站在一起。 致那些仍在受苦的人：你们没有被遗忘，我们继续为你们而战。

column2: The Alliance between the United States and the Republic of Korea was forged in shared sacrifice. Nearly 70 years since the Korean Armistice, the threat of conflict remains, but as I said at the DMZ, the U.S.-ROK Alliance stands ready to address any contingency.
column3: 哈里斯副总统：美国和大韩民国之间的联盟建立于共同的牺牲之上。《朝鲜停战协定》已经签订了近70年，而冲突的威胁依然存在。但是正如我在韩朝非军事区所说，美国-大韩民国联盟随时准备应对任何突发状况。

column2: Jill and I extend our hearts to the family of Tyre Nichols – they deserve a swift, full, and transparent investigation. Tyre’s death is a painful reminder that we must do more to ensure that our justice system lives up to the promise of fairness and dignity for all.
column3: 拜登总统：吉尔和我向泰尔·尼科尔斯的家人致以慰问——他们理应看到这件事得到迅速、全面和透明的调查。 泰尔的去世严酷地提醒我们，必须采取更多行动，来确保我们的司法体系履行人人享有公平公正和尊严的承诺。

column2: Congrats to Karine Jean-Pierre, the next White House . 's promotion is so well deserved and will mean so much to so many in the United States and around the world. And to my friend and mentor Jen Psaki: Congrats on an amazing run. Get some rest for the rest of us!
column3: 国务院发言人内德·普赖斯：祝贺卡琳·让-皮埃尔（Karine Jean-Pierre）成为下一任白宫新闻秘书。卡琳·让-皮埃尔的升职是众望所归，对于在美国和世界各地的很多人来说都意义重大。对我的良师益友珍·莎琪（Jen Psaki），我想说：为这段精彩的旅程和时光祝贺你。为了我们大家，好好休息！

column2: We join our Philippine allies in calling on the PRC to stop its provocative actions in the South China Sea, including the amassing of its maritime militia around Iroquois Reef & Sabina Shoal, and interfering with lawful Philippine fishing activities there.
column3: 美国国务院发言人：我们与我们的菲律宾盟友一道要求中华人民共和国停止其在南中国海的挑衅行动。这些行动包括将其海上民兵聚集在易洛魁礁和萨比纳礁附近，以及干涉菲律宾在那里的合法捕捞行为。

column2: Our condolences to the family of the U.S. citizen killed in Ukraine, whose remains are being returned. We thank Ukraine for ensuring the remains were included in the exchange so the family can be granted some peace.

column3: 普京总统拒绝了美国以及我们的盟友和伙伴为通过对话着手解决我们彼此的安全关切而做出的每一项努力。我们现制裁普京、拉夫罗夫、绍伊古和格拉西莫夫，以回应俄罗斯对乌克兰的无理入侵。

Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.” As we remember the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., his words continue to inspire us to work for peace, equity, and justice.	布林肯国务卿：“任何地方的不公正都威胁着每个地方的公正。”在我们铭记马丁·路德·金博士的遗产时，他的话语继续激励我们为和平、公平和正义努力。

column2: At our delayed (by COVID) Independence Day event, I said: Americans have a deep, abiding faith in human freedom. We believe all people have individual rights no government can take away. Freedom of Religion, Speech, Press, Assembly.
column3: 在我们(被疫情)延迟的独立日活动中，我说道：美国人有着对人类自由深刻、坚定的信念。我们相信所有人都有任何政府皆不可剥夺的个人权利。宗教、言论、新闻和集会自由。

column2: I met yesterday with Director General Grossi on a range of critical global security concerns, including Russia’s illegal and unprovoked war against Ukraine. The U.S. remains committed to ensuring the IAEA has the resources needed to fulfill its responsibilities.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：我昨天与国际原子能机构总干事格罗西会晤，讨论了一系列至关重要的全球安全关切，包括俄罗斯对乌克兰非法和无端的战争。美国仍然致力于确保国际原子能机构拥有履行其职责所需的资源。

column2: Addressed the Media Summit of the Americas and spoke with journalism students from  ASU about the future of media freedom. I underscored the U.S. commitment to a safe and free press in the Americas and globally. SummitAmericas
column3: 布林肯国务卿：在美洲国家媒体峰会上发表了讲话，并和来自亚利桑那州立大学沃尔特·克朗凯特新闻和大众传媒学院 ASU的新闻学生谈论媒体自由的未来。我强调美国对在美洲和全球范围内安全和自由媒体的承诺。

column2: With over 2,100 people strong across 47 agencies and five posts, U.S. Mission China is one team dedicated to working hard on the world’s most consequential bilateral relationship. I am proud of this Mission and what it does to advance U.S. interests with the PRC.
column3: 伯恩斯大使：“美国驻华使团的团队分布在五个驻地，有来自47个部门的超过2100名人员，这个团队为世界上最重要的双边关系而兢兢业业地工作。我为这个使团以及它在与中华人民共和国交往时推进美国利益所做的工作而感到骄傲。”

column2: . on President Putin’s war in Ukraine: “One man chose this war. And one man can end it because if Russia stops fighting, the war ends. If Ukraine stops fighting, Ukraine ends." UNGA

column2: . reiterated today that Ukraine is under direct threat from Russia, but that threat also has very real implications for Americans, Europeans, and global peace and security. We must stand united to debunk the pretext Russia is creating.

column2: Our statement on the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

column2: .: The U.S & NATO are not a threat to Russia. We’re not targeting the people of Russia. To the citizens of Russia: you are not our enemies…WWII was a war of necessity. If Russia attacks Ukraine, it will be a war of choice – a war without cause or reason. The truth matters.

column2: Our efforts in fighting the COVID-19 pandemic will help us tackle other outbreaks around the world, like monkeypox and other diseases. The health of our people is simply more secure and we can prevent new pandemics when we’re working together.
column3: 我们在抗击新冠大流行中付出的努力将帮助我们应对世界各地的其他疫情，如猴痘和其他疾病。只要我们共同努力，我们人民的健康就会更有保障，而且我们可以预防新的大流行病。

column2: Freedom of religion is a human right. At the IRFSummit2022, I affirmed our commitment to protecting and promoting religious freedom for all people, everywhere. I thank everyone for coming together to advance these efforts.

column2: The African and Diaspora Young Leaders Forum at the USAfricaLeadersSummit22 was an important dialogue between U.S. officials and the African diaspora. I'm looking forward to seeing the innovative ideas we discussed grow and blossom into life-changing and saving solutions.

column2: We honor the bravery, courage, and sacrifice that U.S. and Allied forces exhibited on the shores of Normandy 78 years ago. attended the DDay78 commemoration today at Omaha Beach and met with veterans.

column2: With vaccines, treatments, and other tools widely available, more than 220 million Americans are vaccinated, more than 100 million Americans have their booster shot, and daily deaths due to COVID-19 are down 90%. We've come a long way in our fight against COVID-19.
column3: 因为疫苗、治疗和其他工具的广泛可得，超过2.2亿美国人已接种疫苗，超过1亿美国人打了加强针，新冠肺炎的日均死亡人数下降了90%。 在与新冠肺炎的战斗中，我们已经取得了长足进展。

column2: If we allow the rules of the international order to be flagrantly trampled anywhere, we weaken them everywhere. We must condemn, firmly and unequivocally, Russia’s attempt to topple a democratically elected government, and its gross human rights abuses and violations.

column2: On Memorial Day, we remember the patriots who gave their lives in the service of America, in the service of freedom, and in the service of justice. We are free because they were brave, and we live by the light of the flame of liberty they kept burning. We are forever grateful.
column3: 拜登总统：在阵亡将士纪念日，我们缅怀那些为美国服务、为自由服务和为正义服务而献出生命的爱国者。因为他们的勇敢，我们是自由的，生活在他们一直在燃烧的自由之火的光芒下。我们永远心怀感激。

column2: This WomensHistoryMonth, I thank the women past and present who have joined us and blazed trails so we can have a workforce that represents America. And I especially want to thank and for your leadership and work to transform our diplomacy.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：在这个妇女历史月，我感谢过去和现在同我们一道开辟道路的女性，让我们能够有一支代表美国的工作队伍。而且我特别要感谢马德琳·奥尔布赖特和康多莉扎·赖斯，因为你们的领导力和努力改变了我们的外交。

column2: Today I was honored to swear in Nicholas Burns, our newly confirmed Ambassador to the People’s Republic of China. Ambassador Burns will be a strong voice protecting and advancing U.S. interests in our relationship with the PRC, and I look forward to working with him again.
column3: 谢尔曼常务副国务卿：今天我很荣幸为我们新获确认的驻中华人民共和国大使尼古拉斯·伯恩斯举行宣誓就职仪式。伯恩斯大使将成为我们与中华人民共和国的关系中保护和促进美国利益的强有力的声音。我期待再次与他共事。

column2: .: We will never recognize any efforts by Russia to change Ukraine’s borders by force. We must hold the perpetrators of these atrocities to account. We must respond as an international community — an international community that still respects the Charter.
column3: 美国常驻联合国代表琳达·托马斯-格林菲尔德大使：我们永远不会承认俄罗斯用武力改变乌克兰的边界。我们必须将实施这些暴行的人绳之以法。我们必须作出国际社会的反应——一个仍然尊重联合国宪章的国际社会。

column2: I’m once again using my presidential authority to activate emergency security assistance to continue helping Ukraine fend off Russia’s assault. An additional $800 million. That brings the total in new U.S. security assistance to Ukraine to $1 billion just this week.
column3: 拜登总统：现在，我再次行使总统权力启动额外的安全援助，以继续帮助乌克兰抵御俄罗斯的攻击——这次追加的援助达 8 亿美元。这使得美国对乌克兰的最新安全援助总额仅在本周就达到了 10 亿美元。

column2: We released the first-ever public U.S. government report showing our work to advance the human rights of LGBTQI+ persons globally. We urge all governments to act with us to support LGBTQI+ human rights defenders in their tireless and noble work.
column3: 我们发布了有史以来的第一份公开的美国政府报告，展示我们为在全球推动男女同性恋、双性恋、跨性别者、酷儿及间性人等人士（LGBTQI+）的人权所作的工作。我们敦促所有政府与我们一起采取行动，支持LGBTQI+人权捍卫者不懈和崇高的工作。

column2: . arrived in Bali, where he will participate in meetings with G20 nations to strengthen multilateral cooperation and address food and energy security.
column3: 布林肯国务卿SecBlinken 已抵达巴厘岛，他将在这里参加与二十国集团 G20 国家的会议，以加强多边合作并着手解决粮食和能源安全问题。

column2: . on : We warned that Putin was threatening this aggression, and we said if he pursued it, there'd be massive consequences for Russia. We've delivered on that promise. UnitedWithUkraine
column3: 布林肯国务卿在《与媒体见面》节目上表示：我们有警告过，普京在威胁发动这次侵略，而且我们说过，如果普京进行侵略，俄罗斯将面临重大的后果。我们说到做到了。与乌克兰团结在一起 UnitedWithUkraine

column2: .: "Our support for Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity as well as for the government and people of Ukraine is unwavering. We stand with our Ukrainian partners in strongly condemning President Putin’s announcement."
column3: 布林肯国务卿：“我们坚定不移地支持乌克兰主权和领土完整，坚定不移地支持乌克兰政府和人民。我们与我们的乌克兰伙伴一起强烈谴责普京总统宣布的决定。”

column2: The relationship between the U.S. and China is highly consequential for our countries but also for the world. We’re committed to managing this relationship, this competition, responsibly as the world expects us to do, leading with diplomacy.
column3: “美国和中国的关系对我们两国极为重要，对世界也是如此。我们致力于如世界期待的那样，负责任地通过外交引领来管理好这个关系和这一竞争。”布林肯国务卿

column2: Doug and I send our warmest wishes to all who are celebrating Eid al-Fitr. Muslims in the U.S. and around the world celebrate after a month of deep reflection, helping those in need, and connecting with community. From our family to yours, Eid Mubarak!
column3: 哈里斯副总统：道格和我向所有正在庆祝开斋节的人致以最温暖的祝福。美国和世界各地的穆斯林在用一个月的时间进行深刻内省、帮助有需要的人以及与社群建立联系后进行庆祝。我们全家祝您和您的家人开斋节吉祥欢乐（Eid Mubarak）！

column2: President Biden is fully vaccinated, twice boosted, and experiencing mild symptoms following a positive COVID-19 test. Read a letter from Dr. Kevin O’Connor, Physician to the President:
column3: 拜登总统已完成全剂量疫苗接种，接种了两剂加强针，在新冠检测结果呈阳性后症状轻微。点击此处，阅读总统医师凯文·奥康纳博士写的一封信：

column2: A great day at U.S. Mission China. We raised the Pride flags at the Embassy & the Ambassador’s residence to celebrate the diversity & importance of the LGBTQI+ community – a beautiful part of America’s fabric & each & every society around the. PrideMonth LoveIsLove
column3: 美国驻华使团美好的一天。我们在大使馆和大使官邸升起彩虹旗，来庆祝LGBTQI+群体的多元和重要性—这是美国肌理，也是各地每一个社会，美丽的一部分。骄傲月 PrideMonth 爱就是爱 LoveIsLove

column2: As said:“Putin chose this war. And now he and his country will bear the consequences.” His premeditated war will bring a catastrophic loss of life and needless human suffering. We will respond severely and in lockstep with our Allies and partners. UnitedWithUkraine.
column3: 正如拜登总统所说：“普京选择开战。现在他和他的国家将承担后果”。普京发动的有预谋的战争将造成灾难性的人员伤亡和无谓的苦难。我们将予以严厉回应——与我们的北约盟友和伙伴协调一致。与乌克兰团结在一起UnitedWithUkraine

column2: It bears repeating: LGBTQI+ rights are human rights. With pride, I dropped by the LGBTI+ Core Group to discuss how by working together, we can build a world where people can live authentically and enjoy their human rights everywhere.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：值得重申的是：LGBTQI+群体的权利就是人权。我很自豪地来到联合国LGBTI+核心小组，讨论我们我们可以怎样通过共同努力，来打造一个人们在任何地方都可以活出真实的自己并享有人权的世界。

column2: Today, on World Refugee Day, I join people around the world in recognizing the strength, resilience, and humanity of the millions of refugees forced to flee violence, persecution, and war. Those who find refuge in America — a proud nation of immigrants — enrich our country.
column3: 拜登总统：今天是世界难民日，我和世界各地的人们一道对数以百万计被迫逃离暴力、迫害和战争难民的力量、坚韧和人性表示认可。 美国是一个自豪的移民国家。那些在美国找到避难之处的人丰富了我们的国家。

column2: The U.S. will host the 9th on June 6-10 in Los Angeles, California, where leaders will meet to address the Americas' shared challenges and opportunities. Join us on the RoadtotheSummit!
column3: 美国将于6月6日至10日在加利福尼亚州洛杉矶举办第九届美洲国家峰会，各领导人将举行会晤以应对美洲共同的挑战和机遇。加入我们的峰会之路！

column2: We are deeply saddened by the loss of life caused by the explosion in Istanbul today. We extend our sincerest condolences to the families of the victims and the Turkish people. The United States stands united with our Turkish Allies.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：对于今日伊斯坦布尔的爆炸造成的人员伤亡，我们深表悲痛。我们向受害者家属以及土耳其人民致以我们最诚挚的哀悼。美国与我们的土耳其盟友团结地站在一起。

column2: Jill and I are devastated to learn that at least two Americans are among so many who lost their lives in Seoul. Our hearts go out to their loved ones in this time of grief, and we continue to pray for the recovery of all who were injured.
column3: 拜登总统：获悉在首尔的众多遇难者中至少有两名美国人，吉尔和我极为痛心。在这个悲痛的时刻，我们向他们的至爱亲朋表示慰问，并继续祈祷所有伤者能够康复。

column2: Religious freedom is a key element of an open and stable society. On this Religious Freedom Day, we reaffirm our commitment to protecting and advancing the fundamental right of religious freedom, both at home and abroad.
column3: 宗教自由是开放、稳定社会的一个关键因素。在美国国家宗教自由日，我们重申致力于在国内和国外保护和推进宗教自由的基本权利。

column2: In a moment when Putin has shattered peace in Europe and attacked the very tenets of the rules-based order, the United States and our Allies are stepping up to support Ukraine and boost our defenses. We’re proving that NATO is more needed now than it ever has been.
column3: 拜登总统：在普京打破欧洲的和平并攻击基于规则的秩序的原则之时，美国和我们的盟友正在加强我们对乌克兰的支持，并强化我们的防御。我们在证明北约在此时比以往任何时候都更有必要。

column2: Whether they identify openly or not, LGBTQI+ persons play an integral role in every community. This NationalComingOutDay, we celebrate the contributions of LGBTQI+ persons as we work toward a world where everyone has the safety and acceptance to live openly.
column3: 无论男女同性恋、双性恋、跨性别者、酷儿、间性者等（LGBTQI+）人士是否公开自己的身份，他们在每个社群都发挥着不可或缺的作用。 值此美国国家出柜日 NationalComingOutDay，我们赞颂LGBTQI+人士的贡献，我们正在努力建设一个人人都能安全和被接纳地公开生活的世界。

column2: . and Prime Minister of Japan jointly condemned the DPRK’s missile test in the strongest terms and confirmed they would continue to closely coordinate their immediate and longer-term response.
column3: 拜登总统和日本首相岸田文雄以最强烈的措辞共同谴责朝鲜的导弹试射，并确认他们将继续密切协调即刻和长期的应对措施。

column2: . John Kerry previews the upcoming COP27: We’re working very closely with all of our allies, with many many countries, and around the world, in order to principally raise climate ambition. That’s the fundamental goal. ClimateAction
column3: 气候变化问题总统特使克里 谈即将到来的COP27：我们正在与所有的盟友，与许许多多国家以及世界各地进行非常密切的合作，以便在今年的COP会议上大幅提升气候雄心。这是最根本的目标。ClimateAction

column2: Strong, clear words from : “American diplomacy matters.” Democracies are rising to the moment. The world is clearly choosing the side of peace and security. Autocracies are losing. We are UnitedWithUkraine. SOTU
column3: 布林肯国务卿：来自拜登总统强有力、明确的话：“美国的外交至关重要。”民主的力量应运而起，世界显然是站在和平与安全的一边。专制正在失败。我们 与乌克兰团结在一起 。UnitedWithUkraine SOTU

column2: .: Democracies are rising to meet this moment, rallying the world to the side of peace and the side of security. We’re showing our strength, and we will not falter. UnitedWithUkraine
column3: 拜登总统:民主国家临危不惧，正在应对这一挑战，呼吁全世界站在和平与安全这一边。我们正在展示我们的力量，我们不会动摇。 UnitedWithUkraine

column2: This morning, I met with my G7 counterparts to discuss President Putin’s unjustified attack on Ukraine and we agreed to move forward on devastating packages of sanctions and other economic measures to hold Russia to account. We stand with the brave people of Ukraine.
column3: 拜登总统：今天上午，我和七国集团（G7）首脑举行会晤，讨论普京总统对乌克兰发动的无端攻击。我们一致同意推进毁灭性的一揽子制裁措施和其他经济措施，追究俄罗斯的责任。我们与勇敢的乌克兰人民站在一起。

column2: . on Russia: It’s not only an aggression against Ukraine. It is an aggression against the basic principles that are embodied in the charter, Universal Declaration of Human Rights, and a whole series of norms and rules that many generations labored to build.
column3: 布林肯国务卿谈俄罗斯：这不仅仅是对乌克兰的侵略。这是对《联合国宪章》《世界人权宣言》以及许多代人通过艰苦努力建立起的一整个系列规范和规则所体现的基本原则的侵略。

column2: . will travel to 🇰🇭, August 3-5, to attend ASEAN Meetings & Forums, followed by a visit to the 🇵🇭, on August 6. There the Secretary will meet President to discuss bilateral efforts to strengthen the U.S.-Philippines alliance.
column3: 布林肯国务卿将于8月3日至5日前往柬埔寨加东盟会议和论坛，随后于8月6日访问菲律宾。届时国务卿将与菲律宾总统马科斯举行会晤，讨论加强美菲联盟的双边努力。

column2: Today, designated entities and individuals involved in attempting to evade the United States and our partners’ sanctions on Russia. Those who take part in or facilitate sanctions evasion for sanctioned Russian entities are complicit in Putin’s brutal war of choice.
column3: 今天[4月20日]，美国财政部列出涉及试图逃避美国及伙伴对俄罗斯制裁的实体和个人。那些参与或协助受制裁的俄罗斯实体逃避制裁的人，都是普京发动的本不必打的残酷战争中的共犯。

column2: . on his trip to the Indo-Pacific region: "We’ll be first...meeting with the Quad countries...following up on the leader level summit...and pursuing the work that I think is vital to the interests of Americans but also people throughout the region & around the world."
column3: 布林肯国务卿在访问印太地区时说：“我们将首先......与““四方会谈””（Quad）国家举行会晤......跟进领导人级峰会......并开展我认为对美国人乃至整个地区和世界各地人民的利益至关重要的工作。” 布林肯国务卿在前往澳大利亚墨尔本途中向媒体发表的讲话全文请见：

column2: . on the DPRK's ballistic missile launch: "Our commitment to the defense of the ROK & Japan remains ironclad, & we’ll remain in very close touch w/ our treaty allies in the Indo-Pacific & with our allies...around the world on this as well."
column3: 美国国务院发言人谈朝鲜弹道导弹发射：“我们致力于韩国和日本的防御的决心仍然坚定不移，而且我们也将与我们在印太地区的条约盟友以及我们......在世界各地的盟友就此保持非常密切的联系。”

column2: Spoke today with ’s and ’s on human rights challenges, including in Ukraine, Russia, China, and the Middle East. Human rights are central to U.S. foreign policy. We support the important work of human rights defenders.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：“今天与人权观察的肯尼思・罗斯以及国际特赦组织的艾格尼丝·卡拉马德就包括在乌克兰、俄罗斯、中国和中东的人权挑战进行了谈话。人权是美国外交政策的核心。我们支持人权捍卫者的重要工作。”

column2: ., Austin, and Ambassador Emanuel will virtually meet Japanese FM Hayashi and for the 2022 U.S.-Japan Security Consultative Committee Meeting on Jan. 6. We will strengthen our alliance to address global challenges.
column3: 布林肯国务卿，奥斯汀国防部长 和伊曼纽尔大使将于1月6日与日本外务大臣林芳正及防务大臣岸信夫以视频形式举行“2022年美日安全磋商委员会会议”。我们将加强我们的联盟关系以着手应对全球挑战。

column2: NASA’s Artemis is in flight. This ship will enable the first woman and first person of color to set foot on the lunar surface and will lead countless students to become explorers and show America’s limitless possibilities to the world.
column3: 拜登总统：美国国家航空航天局的阿尔忒弥斯在飞行途中了。 飞船将会让首位女性宇航员和首位非白人宇航员踏上月球表面，也会引领无数学子成为探险者，向世界展示美国无限的可能性。

column2: .: Together with our allies we are providing support to the Ukrainians in their fight for freedom. We are giving more than $1 billion in direct assistance to Ukraine. SOTU UnitedWithUkraine
column3: 拜登总统：我们正在与我们的盟友一起，为乌克兰人民争取自由的斗争提供支持。我们正在向乌克兰提供超过10亿美元的直接援助。SOTU UnitedWithUkraine

column2: Next week I will travel to Australia, Fiji, and Hawaii to advance our shared goals in the Indo-Pacific region. Looking forward to engagement with Pacific Island leaders, productive discussions with Japan & ROK leaders, and meeting with friends of the U.S. at the Quad Ministerial.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：我将前往澳大利亚、斐济和夏威夷，推进我们在印太地区的共同目标。期待与太平洋岛国领导人进行互动，与日本和大韩民国领导人进行富有成效的讨论，并在“四方会谈”部长级会议上与美国的朋友们会面。

column2: Had an excellent trip to Melbourne for the Quad, Fiji to meet with Pacific Island leaders, and Honolulu for a trilateral meeting with Japan and the ROK. The U.S. is a proud part of the Indo-Pacific, and this region is critically important to our nation’s security and prosperity.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：我非常愉快地在墨尔本参加了四方会谈，在斐济与太平洋岛国领导人进行了会面，在檀香山与日本和大韩民国举行了三边会议。美国是印太地区的骄傲组成部分，该地区对我们国家的安全与繁荣至关重要。

column2: We have provided Ukraine consistent, significant support for its defense, and we will continue that steadfast support for the Ukrainian people for as long as it takes.
column3: 我们为乌克兰的防卫提供了持续、重要的支持，我们将坚持到底继续坚定地为乌克兰人民提供支持。

column2: . addressed the world at UNGA, reminding the assembled leaders that shared challenges require shared action, and underscoring U.S. determination to end conflict, advance human rights, and to unite to tackle food insecurity and global health challenges.
column3: 美国总统拜登在联合国大会 UNGA 上向全世界发表讲话，提醒与会领导人，共同的挑战需要共同的行动，并强调美国决心结束冲突，促进人权，团结大家共同应对粮食不安全和全球卫生挑战。

column2: This morning President Biden remained positive for COVID and continues to feel well. An update from Dr. O’Connor, Physician to the President:
column3: 今早拜登总统的新冠病毒检测结果仍然呈阳性，他依然感觉良好。 总统医师奥康纳博士的最新情况通报：

column2: On Peace Officers Memorial Day, we honor all who have fallen in the line of duty — local, federal and international law enforcement as well as personnel. These special agents & other security personnel made the ultimate sacrifice supporting U.S. diplomacy worldwide.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：在维护和平执法人员纪念日，我们向所有因公殉职的人致敬——包括地方、联邦和国际执法机构以及国务院外交安全勤务处人员。这些特别探员和其他安全人员为支持全世界范围内的美国外交活动做出了最大的牺牲。

column2: 🇺🇸🇹🇴 Our support of US2.6million for Tonga in the aftermath of TongaVolcanoEruption is in addition to longstanding programs has in Tonga that are already responding to urgent needs. Learn more about how we're supporting:
column3: 美国驻斐济大使馆: 除了美国国际发展署太平洋岛国项目在汤加设立的已用于应急需求的长期项目外，我们在汤加火山喷发 TongaVolcanoEruption 后还为汤加 Tonga 提供了260万美元的额外支持。 了解更多关于我们提供支持的信息：

column2: I'm proud to speak for the , and to be one of many LGBTQI+ employees and allies working here and abroad. I invite you to join our ranks and build on the rich contributions of LGBTQI+ individuals to U.S. diplomatic history and policy.
column3: 发言人普赖斯表示：我很自豪为美国国务院发声，也很自豪我是在这里和国外工作的众多男女同性恋、双性恋、跨性别者、酷儿、间性人及其他群体（LGBTQI+）雇员和盟友中的一员。我邀请你加入到我们中来，在LGBTQI+个人对美国外交历史和政策的丰富贡献基础上继续前行。

column2: I want to speak directly to the people of Ukraine. Your bravery and dedication to your country, culture, and democracy is an inspiration to the world. We have been, and will remain, UnitedWithUkraine.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：我想直接向乌克兰人民讲话。你们的勇气以及你们对于你们的国家、文化和民主的矢志不渝鼓舞了世界。我们一直并将继续 与乌克兰团结在一起 UnitedWithUkraine。

column2: Native Americans have persevered, despite a painful history. During NativeAmericanHeritageMonth, we celebrate the contributions of Native Americans and honor them. I am especially grateful to those serving with ; they strengthen our diplomacy.
column3: 美国原住民在历史上历尽艰辛，却坚持了下来。在 美国原住民历史月 NativeAmericanHeritageMonth，我们颂扬美国原住民的贡献并向他们致敬。我要特别感谢那些在美国国务院工作的原住民。他们加强了我们的外交。

column2: I have authorized a drawdown of up to $200 million for additional arms and equipment to Ukraine. This unprecedented fourth drawdown in less than a year will bring total U.S. security assistance provided to Ukraine to more than $1.2 billion since January 2021.

column2: Nations flourish when individuals can practice their religion or belief free from government interference or social restrictions. On National Religious Freedom Day, we renew our resolve to champion freedom of religion or belief as a universal right for all people.

column2: Our relationships and treaty alliances in the Indo-Pacific region are among our strongest in the world. Together we are advancing our vision for a free and open region where countries are able to make their own sovereign decisions.

column2: Great discussion with during the U.S.-EU Dialogue on China and Indo-Pacific Consultations to advance our shared goals to address global challenges. The United States and EU have never been more aligned on our work together.

column2: . has arrived to lead the team. Ambassador Brink will do tremendous work on behalf of the American people as we continue to demonstrate our strong support for Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity. UnitedWithUkraine

column2: The United States, along with our Allies and partners, has underscored our readiness to impose significant costs on Russia if it takes further military action against Ukraine. The preference remains de-escalation through diplomacy. More:

column2: Embassy Beijing honored our community’s veterans and family members at a poignant VeteransDay ceremony. Today, Every day, We honor 🇺🇸 veterans for their -- and their families’ -- sacrifices in defense of peace, justice, democracy, and freedom. THANK YOU.
column3: 在一场触动人心的退伍军人节 VeteransDay 纪念典礼上，美国驻华大使馆向我们社群中的退伍军人和家属致敬。 今天， 每一天， 我们致敬 美国 退伍军人。 致敬他们，还有他们的家人们， 为了捍卫和平、正义、民主与自由 做出的牺牲。 谢谢你们。

column2: Workers have many responsibilities outside of work. Protecting non-work time and providing greater flexibility and autonomy in the workplace can help workers fulfill these responsibilities and better harmonize work and home.
column3: 你每天花很多时间在工作上......这是你家以外的家。你能在工作中感到安全和有保障是至关重要的，就像你在自己家的四壁之内一样。你在工作中的身心健康需要什么支持？

column2: The United States and our Allies agree: We stand united in support of Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity.
column3: 美国和我们的盟友意见一致：我们团结在一起，支持乌克兰的主权和领土完整。

column2: . spoke with UK Foreign Secretary to coordinate on our response to Russian aggression toward Ukraine, as well as ongoing People’s Republic of China economic coercion, and the urgency of a mutual return to the JCPOA.
column3: 布林肯国务卿与英国外交大臣伊丽莎白·特拉斯进行了通话，协调我们对俄罗斯进犯乌克兰以及中华人民共和国持续的经济胁迫的应对措施，以及各方重返《联合全面行动计划》（JCPOA） 的紧迫性。

column2: . will travel to Bali, Indonesia, and Bangkok, Thailand, July 6-11 to attend the Foreign Ministers' Meeting and to reinforce our ties with important partners in the Indo-Pacific.
column3: 布林肯国务卿将于2022年7月6日至11日访问印度尼西亚巴厘岛和泰国曼谷，参加二十国集团 外长会议并加强我们与印太地区重要伙伴的关系。

column2: Today, I was pleased to join & our Indo-Pacific partners for the launch of the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework, an important first step in advancing competitiveness and economic prosperity across the US and Indo-Pacific Region
column3: 雷蒙多部长：今天，我很高兴与美国总统拜登及我们的印太伙伴一道启动印太经济框架，这是在美国和印太地区增进竞争力与经济繁荣的重要第一步。

column2: No country faces the threat of COVID-19 alone. The 🇺🇸 has donated 610 million doses to 115 countries—for free, with no strings attached—the largest commitment of any country. We will continue to do all we can.
column3: 没有任何一个国家能够单独应付新冠疫情的威胁。美国 已经向115个国家捐赠6.1亿剂疫苗，完全免费，没有任何条件，这是所有国家中最大的承诺。我们会继续尽我们能力所及。

column2: We welcome 's adoption of massive sanctions against Russia. Together with our allies and partners, we are holding Putin to account for his flagrant violation of international law. As said yesterday, "Our unity is our strength."
column3: 布林肯国务卿：我们欢迎欧盟理事会通过针对俄罗斯的重大制裁。与我们的盟友和伙伴们一起，我们在追究普京公然违反国际法的责任。正如欧盟委员会主席冯德莱恩昨天所说：“我们的团结是我们的力量。”

column2: Good call today with  EEAS High Representative about our transatlantic unity in support of Ukraine and close U.S.-EU cooperation on the PRC and Iran.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：今天与欧盟对外行动署 EEAS的欧盟外交与安全政策高级代表何塞普·博雷利进行了很不错的通话，讨论了我们在支持乌克兰上的跨大西洋团结，以及就中华人民共和国和伊朗开展密切的美欧合作。

column2: Fifty three years ago, a movement was born at the Stonewall Inn. Today, we celebrate the generations of LGBTQI+ people who have fought to make the possibilities of our nation real for every American. It is with pride that we continue what they started.
column3: 拜登总统：53年前，一场运动在石墙酒吧诞生。今天，我们庆祝一代代为了让我们国家的可能性对每个美国人来说都成为现实而奋斗的LGBTQI+人士。我们带着骄傲继续由他们开始的工作。

column2: Today I spoke with President Xi Jinping of the People’s Republic of China as part of our efforts to deepen lines of communication, responsibly manage our differences, and address issues of mutual interest.
column3: 拜登总统：今天，我与中华人民共和国国家主席习近平通话。这次通话是我们深化沟通渠道，负责任地管理我们的分歧并应对共同关心问题的努力的一部分。

column2: Together with our partners and allies, the U.S. continues to impose severe costs on Russia. Today, we designated elites & targets in Russia’s defense and disinformation sectors. We are UnitedWithUkraine and will continue to support Ukraine’s sovereignty.
column3: 美国和我们的伙伴和盟友一道继续向俄罗斯施加严重代价。今天，我们制裁了俄罗斯国防和虚假信息领域的权势人物和目标。我们 与乌克兰团结在一起 UnitedWithUkraine 并继续支持乌克兰的主权。

column2: The U.S. has provided $1 billion toward the $2 billion commitment to African countries for emergency food security assistance. Read more in the fact sheet:

column2: I'm proud of our U.S. Consular Officers in Shanghai working around the clock to help thousands of Americans in lockdown. Responding to Americans in need is job number one for U.S. Mission China at this difficult time.
column3: 伯恩斯大使：“我很自豪，我们在上海的美国领事事务官员夜以继日地工作，帮助封城之下的数千名美国公民。在此艰难时刻，对有需要的美国公民做出响应是美国驻华使团的首要工作。”

column2: The U.S. will continue to keep pressure on the Russian Federation and hold those responsible accountable with our Allies and partners. We continue our united support of Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity.
column3: 美国将继续向俄罗斯联邦施压，并与我们的盟友与伙伴一道向责任方追责。我们继续团结一致支持乌克兰的主权和领土完整。

column2: In response to President Putin's invasion of Ukraine, the U.S. is imposing sweeping economic sanctions on Russia. Ned Price discusses the U.S.’s work with Allies and partners to hold Russia accountable and continue our support for Ukraine.
column3: 为回应普京总统对乌克兰发动的入侵行动，美国将对俄罗斯施加大规模的经济制裁。国务院发言人内德·普赖斯谈了美国与盟友和伙伴采取了哪些举措来追究俄罗斯的责任并继续支持乌克兰。

column2: Today, the United States is announcing that we are prepared to provide more than $1 billion in new funding towards humanitarian assistance for those affected by Russia’s war in Ukraine and its severe impacts around the world:
column3: 今天，美国宣布，我们准备提供超过10亿美元的新资金用于人道主义援助，以帮助那些因俄罗斯在乌克兰境内的战争及其全球严重冲击而受影响的人们。

column2: .: We will not be deterred from supporting Ukraine, and as my colleagues at the and announced today, we will continue to provide security assistance to Ukraine so it can defend itself and its sovereign territory, for as long as it takes.
column3: 国务院发言人：对于支持乌克兰，我们将不会退缩。我在白宫的同事还有美国国防部今天已宣布，我们将继续向乌克兰提供安全援助，以便其可以进行自卫并捍卫其主权领土，不管这需要多长时间。

column2: U.S. Special Representative for the DPRK Sung Kim spoke yesterday with PRC Special Representative Liu to condemn the DPRK’s increasingly destabilizing and escalatory behavior and reaffirm that the United States is committed to diplomacy with the DPRK.

column2: Sending my best wishes to those around the world celebrating the Lunar New Year. Throughout this YearOfTheTiger, may we work together to advance a peaceful and prosperous future for all.

column2: LGBTQI+ activists around the world fight for equal protections, freedom from violence, and respect for human rights. Read more on the actions we've taken this past year to support, promote, and protect the human rights of LGBTQI+ persons.

column2: Freedom of religion or belief is a founding principle of our nation and is enshrined in our Constitution. On International Religious Freedom Day, we recommit to making this freedom we enjoy a reality for everyone, everywhere.

column2: The United States and Ukraine share a common desire for a hopeful and bright future for all Ukrainians. We stand enduringly with the Ukrainian people and remain committed to supporting Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity. Learn more:

column2: . announced $3.75B in support for Ukraine and partners today, including $2.85B in military assistance for Ukraine and vehicles, weapons, and ammunition. Together, we are UnitedWithUkraine for as long as it takes.
column3: 今天，布林肯国务卿宣布向乌克兰和伙伴提供37.5亿美元的支持，包括向乌克兰提供28.5亿美元的军事援助以及车辆、武器和弹药。我们与乌克兰团结在一起，坚持到底。

column2: .: We are ready to be engaged in diplomacy with Russia and our Allies and partners to improve stability and security in Europe as a whole. And we are ready to respond decisively to a Russian attack on Ukraine.

column2: January is National Human Trafficking Prevention Month—a time for organizations, communities, and government to join efforts to combat all forms of human trafficking. The is committed to advancing the fight to EndHumanTrafficking around the world.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：一月是美国的全国防止人口贩运月，这是组织、社区和政府一起努力抗击各种形式的人口贩运的时候。美国国务院致力于在世界各地推进为了终结人口贩运 EndHumanTrafficking 而进行的斗争。

column2: Special Representative for the DPRK Sung Kim held calls with his ROK and Japanese counterparts following recent DPRK ballistic missile launches. Trilateral cooperation is essential for the complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.

column2: On January 5, at 12:01 ET, require a negative COVID-19 test result (taken within 2 days of departure) or proof of recovery for all travelers two years and older to the United States on flights originating from China, including Hong Kong and Macau.

column2: The United States has provided 400 million COVID-19 vaccine doses to over 110 countries and economies and provided nearly $20 billion in relief to vulnerable communities worldwide. Together, we can beat COVID-19.

column2: I spoke today with to coordinate our responses to Russia’s unprovoked attack on Ukraine. We discussed the importance of continued international efforts to hold Moscow accountable for its aggression and to support the Ukrainian people as they confront this crisis.

column2: . will travel to Australia, Fiji & Hawaii Feb. 7-13 to engage w/ Indo-Pacific allies & partners to advance peace, resilience, & prosperity across the region & demonstrate that these partnerships deliver. Follow & .

column2: . joined  Joe today to discuss U.S. support for Ukraine in the face of Russia’s acts of aggression. Read the full transcript here:

column2: The U.S. is providing nearly $54 million in additional humanitarian assistance to the people of Ukraine. This assistance enables humanitarian organizations to support citizens of Ukraine already in need and those newly affected by Russia's unprovoked and unjustified attack.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：美国正向乌克兰人民提供近5400万美元的新增人道主义援助。这批援助使得人道主义组织能够支持已经有需求的乌克兰公民以及那些最近受到俄罗斯无端无理攻击影响的人。

column2: We strongly condemn the Burma military regime’s executions of pro-democracy activists and elected leaders. Such reprehensible acts of violence and repression cannot be tolerated. We remain committed to the people of Burma and their efforts to restore Burma's path to democracy.
column3: 我们强烈谴责缅甸军政府处决支持民主的活动人士和民选领导人。这种应受到谴责的暴力和镇压行动不能被容忍。我们仍然致力于支持缅甸人民以及他们为恢复缅甸的民主道路所做的努力。

column2: Today’s launch of the Artemis I mission heralds a new age of international space cooperation. Congratulations to and all our international partners that made this possible.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：阿尔忒弥斯 Artemis1 号任务于今日发射，预示一个新的国际太空合作时代的来临。向美国国家航空航天局以及我们的各位国际伙伴表示祝贺，他们让这一切成为了可能。

column2: Special Representative for the DPRK Sung Kim held a trilateral call with his ROK and Japanese counterparts to reaffirm U.S. commitment to its allies and the importance of trilateral cooperation in response to recent provocations by the DPRK.
column3: 美国朝鲜事务特别代表金聖(Sung Kim)与韩国、日本的对口官员举行三方通话，重申美国对盟友的承诺以及三方合作的重要性，以回应朝鲜最近的挑衅。

column2: Today, met with German Chancellor in Berlin. They discussed Russia’s continued aggression toward Ukraine and the challenges posed by Iran and the PRC.
column3: 今日[1月20日]，布林肯国务卿与德国总理奥拉夫·朔尔茨在柏林举行会晤。他们讨论了俄罗斯对乌克兰的持续进犯以及伊朗和中华人民共和国构成的挑战。

column2: Spoke by phone this morning with incoming People's Republic of China Foreign Minister Qin Gang as he departs Washington for his new role. We discussed U.S.-PRC relationship and maintaining open lines of communication.
column3: 布林肯国务卿：今早[2023年1月1日]，在中华人民共和国即将上任的外交部长秦刚离开华盛顿赴任新职务之时，与他进行了通话。我们讨论了美中关系以及保持开放的沟通渠道。

column2: Thanks to CICIR President Yuan Peng for my visit and our conversation on the many challenges we face in America's relationship with China.
column3: 非常感谢中国现代国际关系研究院院长袁鹏与我会晤，并对在美国与中国的关系中，我们所面对的诸多挑战进行交谈。

column2: The United States has now donated over 385 million COVID-19 vaccine doses to help ensure everyone has access to vaccinations worldwide, and we remain committed to working with our global partners to help end this pandemic – at home and everywhere.
column3: 目前美国已捐赠超过3.85亿剂新冠疫苗，以帮助确保全世界人人都能获得疫苗。同时我们仍然致力于与全球伙伴共同努力，帮助结束这场疫情大流行，无论是在美国还是在其他地方。

column2: Last year, committed that the United States would donate 1.2 billion COVID-19 vaccine doses around the world. Today we have reached another extraordinary milestone in our effort: 500 million doses shared to date. These were provided at no cost and are saving lives.
column3: 去年，拜登总统承诺美国将在全球捐赠12亿剂COVID-19疫苗。今天，我们的努力达到了又一个非凡的里程碑：迄今为止分享了5亿剂疫苗。这些免费提供的疫苗正在拯救生命。

column2: . met with German Foreign Minister in Berlin today to discuss next steps on Russia’s continued aggression toward Ukraine and PRC coercion against Lithuania.
column3: 布林肯国务卿今日[1月20日]与德国外交部长贝尔伯克在柏林举行会晤，讨论后续步骤来应对俄罗斯对乌克兰的持续进犯以及中华人民共和国对立陶宛的胁迫。

column2: . announced new U.S. military assistance for Ukraine. This includes more long-range artillery that is making a difference on the battlefield. Ukraine’s defenders are standing strong, and we stand united with them.
column3: 布林肯国务卿宣布了美国对乌克兰的新增军事援助。这些援助包括正在战场上发挥作用的远程火箭炮。乌克兰的捍卫者们坚强不倒，我们与他们团结地站在一起。

column2: On July 8, announced up to $400 million in additional U.S. military assistance for Ukraine. Ukraine’s defenders are standing strong, and we stand united with them.
column3: 7月8日，拜登总统宣布向乌克兰追加高达4亿美元的美国军事援助。乌克兰的守卫者们正在坚强挺立，我们与他们站在一起。
